	changes in the other tenants in the shopping centers in which we are located;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F402215F4DD2499D9DE3C16EE69422D5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	pricing, promotions or other actions taken by us or our existing or possible new competitors; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8F7AB1AE381B4692978EE64A996715DF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	unseasonable weather conditions or natural disasters.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We cannot assure you that comparable store net sales will increase at the rates achieved in prior periods or that rates will not decline.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We depend on key personnel, the loss of which may adversely affect our ability to run our business effectively and our results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We benefit from the leadership and performance of our senior management team and other key employees.&#160; If we lose the services of any of our principal executive officers or other skilled and experienced personnel, we may not be able to fully implement our business strategy or run our business effectively and operating results could suffer.&#160; The Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors reviews a succession plan prepared by senior management in consideration of the loss of key personnel positions on a regular basis.&#160; The goal of the succession plan is to have a contingency plan that minimizes disruptions in the workplace until a suitable replacement can be found, but no assurance can be given that we will be able to retain existing or attract additional qualified personnel when needed.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Further, as our business grows, we will need to attract and retain additional qualified personnel in a timely manner and develop, train and manage an increasing number of management-level sales associates and other employees. Competition for qualified employees could require us to pay higher wages and benefits to attract a sufficient number of qualified employees, and increases in the minimum wage or other employee benefit costs could increase our operating expense.&#160; An inability to attract and retain personnel as needed in the future could negatively impact our net sales growth and operating results.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	15
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Increases in transportation costs, climate change regulation and other factors may negatively impact our results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We rely upon various means of transportation, including ship and truck, to deliver products from vendors to our wholesale and logistics facility and from our wholesale and logistics facility to our stores.&#160; Consequently, our results can vary depending upon the price of fuel.&#160; The price of oil has fluctuated drastically over the last few years.&#160; In addition, efforts to combat climate change through reduction of greenhouse gases may result in higher fuel costs through taxation or other means.&#160; Any increases in fuel costs would increase our transportation costs for delivery of product to our wholesale and logistics facility and shipment to our stores, as well as our vendors' transportation costs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition, labor shortages in the transportation industry could negatively affect transportation costs and our ability to supply our stores in a timely manner.&#160; We also rely on efficient and effective operations within our wholesale and logistics facility to ensure accurate product delivery to our stores.&#160; Failure to maintain such operations could adversely affect net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our stores are concentrated within the South, Southwest, Mid-Atlantic and Midwest regions of the United States, which could subject us to regional risks.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our stores are heavily concentrated in certain regions of the United States.&#160; We are subject to regional risks, such as the regional economy, weather conditions and natural disasters, increasing costs of electricity, oil and natural gas, as well as government regulations specific in the states and localities within which we operate.&#160; In addition, recent falling oil prices may adversely affect employment and consumer spending in those states that are within our regions that rely on oil revenues as a significant part of the economies of those states.&#160; We sell a significant amount of team sports merchandise that can be adversely affected by significant weather events that postpone the start of or shorten sports seasons or that limit participation of fans and sports enthusiasts.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Unforeseen events, including public health issues and natural disasters such as earthquakes, hurricanes, tornados, snow or ice storms, floods and heavy rains could; disrupt our operations or the operations of our suppliers; significantly damage or destroy our retail locations; prohibit consumers from traveling to our retail locations; or prevent us from resupplying our stores or wholesale and logistics facility.&#160; We believe that we take reasonable precautions to prepare for such events; however, our precautions may not be adequate to deal with such events in the future.&#160; If such events occur in areas in which we have our wholesale and logistics facility or a concentration of retail stores, or if they occur during peak shopping seasons, it could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We sell a significant amount of licensed team sports merchandise, the sale of which may be subject to fluctuations based on the success or failure of such teams.&#160; The poor performance by college and professional sports teams within our core regions of operations, as well as professional team lockouts, could cause our financial results to fluctuate year over year.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Risks Related to Our Capital Structure
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We manage cash and cash equivalents beyond federally insured limits per financial institution and purchase investments not fully guaranteed by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), subjecting us to investment and credit availability risks.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We manage cash and cash equivalents in various institutions at levels beyond federally insured limits per institution, and we purchase investments not guaranteed by the FDIC.&#160; Accordingly, there is a risk that we will not recover the full principal of our investments or that their liquidity may be diminished.&#160; In an attempt to mitigate this risk, our investment policy emphasizes preservation of principal and liquidity.&#160; We cannot be assured that we will not experience losses on our deposits or investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	16
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage17"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We face risk that financial institutions may fail to fulfill commitments under our committed credit facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have financial institutions that are committed to providing loans under our revolving credit facilities.&#160; There is a risk that these institutions cannot deliver against these obligations in a timely matter, or at all.&#160; If the financial institutions that provide these credit facilities were to default on their obligation to fund the commitments, these facilities would not be available to us, which could adversely affect our liquidity and financial condition.&#160; For discussion of our credit facilities, see "Liquidity and Capital Resources" in Item 7 and Note 5 to our consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Risks Related to Ownership of Our Common Stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The market price of our common stock, like the stock market in general, is likely to be highly volatile.&#160; Factors that could cause fluctuation in our common stock price may include, among other things:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8F0AD796FD6F4D3690C75A03AEA41406" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	actual or anticipated variations in quarterly operating results;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="17B3F193923D4608A7E66978B8813488" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">

	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	changes in financial estimates by investment analysts and our inability to meet or exceed those estimates;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="30B5E2F3B62B42F68FADAAA138F1C8F8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	additions or departures of key personnel;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8B44AFB0CC5141C5BBC757B4CE21548F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	market rumors or announcements by us or by our competitors of significant acquisitions, divestitures or joint ventures, strategic partnerships, large capital commitments or other strategic initiatives;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="9D0407B60FE14B1BB30E6A19FEE22061" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	changes in retail sales data that indicate consumers may spend less on discretionary purchases; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="58F5947651C44FBFAE402CAF6FD826DA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	sales of our common stock by key personnel or large institutional holders.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Many of these factors are beyond our control and may cause the market price of our common stock to decline, regardless of our operating performance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Significant stockholders or potential stockholders may attempt to effect changes or acquire control over our company, which could adversely affect our results of operations and financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Stockholders may from time to time attempt to effect changes, engage in proxy solicitations or advance stockholder proposals.&#160; Responding to proxy contests and other actions by activist stockholders can be costly and time-consuming, disrupting our operations and diverting the attention of our Board of Directors and senior management from the daily operations of our business or pursuing our business strategies. As a result, activist stockholder campaigns could adversely affect our results of operations and financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Risks Related to Governance, Regulatory, Legislative and Legal Matters.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Provisions in our charter documents and Delaware law might deter acquisition bids for us.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Certain provisions of our certificate of incorporation and bylaws may be deemed to have anti-takeover effects and may discourage, delay or prevent a takeover attempt that a stockholder might consider in its best interest.&#160; These provisions, among other things:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="E0356D105A5A48DB9E0E955416A8389C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	classify our Board of Directors into three classes, each of which serves for different three-year periods;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="75E0E82C323745B9BE05CC2472A553A7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide that a director may be removed by stockholders only for cause by a vote of the holders of not less than two-thirds of our shares entitled to vote;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="80021698AE5940719627FAF6B24E6DDF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide that all vacancies on our Board of Directors, including any vacancies resulting from an increase in the number of directors, may be filled by a majority of the remaining directors, even if the number is less than a quorum;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="07EC5D88557C4B27A0D0ED586E241153" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	provide that special meetings of the common stockholders may only be called by the Board of Directors, the Chairman of the Board of Directors or upon the demand of the holders of a majority of the total voting power of all outstanding securities of the Company entitled to vote at any such special meeting; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="0921E1EB8D504FA4AC386148707FFC91" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	call for a vote of the holders of not less than two-thirds of the shares entitled to vote in order to amend the foregoing provisions and certain other provisions of our certificate of incorporation and bylaws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	17
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage18"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition, our Board of Directors, without further action of the stockholders, is permitted to issue and fix the terms of preferred stock, which may have rights senior to those of common stock.&#160; We are also subject to the Delaware business combination statute, which may render a change in control of us more difficult.&#160; Section 203 of the Delaware General Corporation Laws would be expected to have an anti-takeover effect with respect to transactions not approved in advance by the Board of Directors, including discouraging takeover attempts that might result in a premium over the market price for the shares of common stock held by stockholders.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We operate in a number of jurisdictions.&#160; It can be cumbersome to fill needed positions and comply with labor laws and regulations, many of which vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are heavily dependent upon our labor force.&#160; Our compensation packages are designed to provide benefits commensurate with our level of expected service.&#160; However, within our retail and logistics operations, we face the challenge of filling many positions at wage scales that are appropriate to the industry and competitive factors.&#160; We operate in a number of jurisdictions which can make it cumbersome to comply with labor laws and regulations, many of which vary from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.&#160; As a result of these and other factors, we face many external risks and internal factors in meeting our labor needs, including competition for qualified personnel, overall unemployment levels, prevailing wage rates, as well as rising employee benefit costs.&#160; Changes in any of these factors, including a shortage of available workforce in areas in which we operate, could interfere with our ability to adequately service our customers or to open suitable locations and could result in increasing labor costs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We cannot be assured that we will not experience pressure from labor unions or become the target of labor union campaigns.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	While we believe we maintain good relations with our employees, we cannot provide any assurances that we will not experience pressure from labor unions or become the target of labor union campaigns.&#160; The potential for unionization could increase in the United States if federal legislation or regulatory changes are adopted that would facilitate labor organization.&#160; Significant union representation would require us to negotiate wages, salaries, benefits and other terms with many of our employees collectively and could adversely affect our results of operations by increasing our labor costs or otherwise restricting our ability to maximize the efficiency of our operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Changes in federal, state or local laws, or our failure to comply with such laws, could increase our expenses and expose us to legal risks.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Company is subject to numerous laws and regulatory matters relating to the conduct of our business.&#160; In addition, certain jurisdictions have taken a particularly aggressive stance with respect to certain matters and have stepped up enforcement, including fines and other sanctions.&#160;&#160; Such laws and regulatory matters include:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="0C35E7941779405DBC1CAC49FAF65933" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Americans with Disabilities Act and similar state laws that give civil rights protections to individuals with disabilities in the context of employment, public accommodations and other areas;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="7274A95EEC804EE6877D0E232DEFD5DC" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Increasing regulations could expose us to a challenging enforcement environment or to third-party liability (such as monetary recoveries and recoveries of attorney's fees) and could have a material adverse effect on our business and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	18
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our corporate legal department monitors regulatory activity and is active in notifying and updating applicable departments and personnel on pertinent matters and legislation.&#160; Our Human Resources (HR) Department leads HR compliance training programs to ensure our field managers are kept abreast of HR-related regulatory activity that affects their areas of responsibility.&#160; We believe that we are in substantial compliance with applicable environment and other laws and regulations, and although no assurance can be given, we do not foresee the need for any significant expenditure in this area in the near future.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Changes in rules related to accounting for income taxes, changes in tax laws in any of the jurisdictions in which we operate or adverse outcomes from audits by taxing authorities could result in an unfavorable change in our effective tax rate.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We operate our business in numerous tax jurisdictions.&#160; As a result, our effective tax rate is derived from a combination of the federal rate and applicable tax rates in the various states in which we operate.&#160; Our effective tax rate may be lower or higher than our tax rates have been in the past due to numerous factors, including the sources of our income and the tax filing positions we take.&#160; We base our estimate of an effective tax rate at any given point in time upon a calculated mix of the tax rates applicable to our Company and on estimates of the amount of business likely to be done in any given jurisdiction.&#160; Changes in rules related to accounting for income taxes, changes in tax laws in any of the jurisdictions in which we operate, expiration of tax credits formerly available, failure to manage and utilize available tax credits, or adverse outcomes from tax audits that we may be subject to in any of the jurisdictions in which we operate could result in an unfavorable change in our effective tax rate.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Product liability claims or product recalls can adversely affect our business reputation, expose us to lawsuits or increased scrutiny by federal and state regulators and may not be fully covered by insurance.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We sell products, particularly equipment, which entail an inherent risk of product liability and product recall and the resultant adverse publicity. We may be subject to significant claims if the purchase of a defective product from any of our stores causes injury or death. Our merchandise could be subject to a product recall which could reflect negatively on our business reputation. We cannot be assured that product liability claims will not be asserted against us in the future. Any claims made may create adverse publicity that would have a material adverse effect on our business, reputation, financial condition and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We and our vendors maintain insurance with respect to certain of these risks, including product liability insurance and general liability insurance, but in many cases such insurance is expensive, difficult to obtain and no assurance can be given that such insurance can be maintained in the future on acceptable terms, or in sufficient amounts to protect us against losses due to any such events, or at all. Moreover, even though our insurance coverage may be designed to protect us from losses attributable to certain events, it may not adequately protect us from liability and expenses we incur in connection with such events.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Litigation may adversely affect our business, financial condition and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our business is subject to the risk of litigation by employees, consumers, suppliers, competitors, stockholders, government agencies or others through private actions, class actions, administrative proceedings, regulatory actions or other litigation.&#160; The outcome of litigation, particularly class action lawsuits and regulatory actions, is difficult to assess or quantify.&#160; We may incur losses relating to these claims, and in addition, these proceedings could cause us to incur costs and may require us to devote resources to defend against these claims that could adversely affect our results of operations.&#160; For a description of current legal proceedings, see "Part I, Item 3, Legal Proceedings."
</DIV>
</EFX_RISK_FACTORS>

</A>

	Item 1B.&#160;&#160; Unresolved Staff Comments.
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	19
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage20"></A>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNRESOLVED_STAFF_COMMENTS>
<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM2">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 2.&#160;&#160; Properties.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	We currently lease all of our existing 1,044 store locations and expect that our policy of leasing rather than owning will continue as we continue to expand.&#160; Our leases typically provide for terms of five to ten years with options on our part to extend.&#160; Most leases also contain a kick-out clause if projected sales levels are not met and an early termination/remedy option if co-tenancy and exclusivity provisions are violated.&#160; We believe this leasing strategy enhances our flexibility to pursue various expansion opportunities resulting from changing market conditions and to periodically re-evaluate store locations.&#160; See "
</FONT>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1A">
	Risk Factors
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	."
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As current leases expire, we believe we will either be able to obtain lease renewals for present store locations or to obtain leases for equivalent or better locations in the same general area.&#160; Historically, we have not experienced any significant difficulty in either renewing leases for existing locations or securing leases for suitable locations for new stores.&#160; We do not anticipate any such difficulties into Fiscal 2017.&#160; Based primarily on our belief that we maintain good relations with our landlords, that most of our leases are at approximate market rents and that generally we have been able to secure leases for suitable locations, we believe our lease strategy will not be detrimental to our business, financial condition or results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	We own our corporate office building, our wholesale and logistics facility and our Team facility, the latter of which is located in Birmingham, Alabama and warehouses inventory for educational institutions and youth associations.&#160; We believe our wholesale and logistics facility is suitable and adequate to support our operations for many years.&#160; See "
</FONT>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1A">
	Risk Factors
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	."
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Store Locations
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of January 30, 2016, we operated 1,044 stores in 33 contiguous states.&#160; Of these stores, 200 are located in enclosed malls, 23 are free-standing and 821 are located in strip-shopping centers, which are frequently near a Wal-Mart store.&#160; The following shows the number of locations by state
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	as of January 30, 2016:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 14, 2016, we operated 1,046 stores in 33 states.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="FORM10K_HTM_ITEM3">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Item 3.&#160; &#160;Legal Proceedings.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are a party to various legal proceedings incidental to our business.&#160; Where we are able to reasonably estimate an amount of probable loss in these matters based on known facts, we have accrued that amount as a current liability on our balance sheet.&#160; We are not able to reasonably estimate the possible loss or range of loss in excess of the amount accrued for these proceedings based on the information currently available to us, including, among others, (i) uncertainties as to the outcome of pending proceedings (including motions and appeals) and (ii) uncertainties as to the likelihood of settlement and the outcome of any negotiations with respect thereto.&#160; We do not believe that any of these matters will, individually or in the aggregate, have a material effect on our business or financial condition.&#160; We cannot give assurance, however, that one or more of these proceedings will not have a material effect on our results of operations for the period in which they are resolved.&#160; At January 30, 2016 and January 31, 2015, we estimated that the liability related to these matters was approximately $0.2 million and $0.4 million, respectively, and accordingly, we accrued $0.2 million and $0.4 million, respectively, as a current liability in our consolidated balance sheets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	20
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The estimates of our liability for pending and unasserted potential claims do not include litigation costs.&#160; It is our policy to accrue legal fees when it is probable that we will have to defend against known claims or allegations and we can reasonably estimate the amount of the anticipated expense.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	From time to time, we enter into certain types of agreements that require us to indemnify parties against third-party claims under certain circumstances.&#160; Generally, these agreements relate to: (a) agreements with vendors and suppliers under which we may provide customary indemnification to our vendors and suppliers in respect to actions they take at our request or otherwise on our behalf; (b) agreements to indemnify vendors against trademark and copyright infringement claims concerning merchandise manufactured specifically for or on behalf of the Company; (c) real estate leases, under which we may agree to indemnify the lessors from claims arising from our use of the property; and (d) agreements with our directors, officers and employees, under which we may agree to indemnify such persons for liabilities arising out of their relationship with us.&#160; We have director and officer liability insurance, which, subject to the policy's conditions, provides coverage for indemnification amounts payable by us with respect to our directors and officers up to specified limits and subject to certain deductibles.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	If we believe that a loss is both probable and estimable for a particular matter, the loss is accrued in accordance with the requirements of ASC Topic 450,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Contingencies
</FONT>
	.&#160; With respect to any matter, we could change our belief as to whether a loss is probable or estimable, or its estimate of loss, at any time.
</DIV>
</EFX_PROPERTIES>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	Dividend Policy
</U>
</FONT>
	.&#160; We have never declared or paid any dividends on our common stock.&#160; We currently intend to retain our future earnings to finance the growth and development of our business and for our stock repurchase program, and therefore do not anticipate declaring or paying cash dividends on our common stock for the foreseeable future.&#160; Any future decision to declare or pay dividends will be at the discretion of our Board of Directors and will be dependent upon our financial condition, results of operations, capital requirements and such other factors as our Board of Directors deems relevant.
</DIV>

	Equity Compensation Plans

	.&#160; For information on securities authorized for issuance under our equity compensation plans, see "Part III, Item 12, Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management and Related Stockholder Matters."

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Period

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<TABLE ID="5833B87F7495436D8462C8490D6CD828" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 99.53%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Item 7.&#160; &#160;Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.47%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	The following discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with Item 6, "
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_ITEM6">
	Selected Consolidated Financial Data
</A>
	" and our consolidated financial statements and related notes appearing elsewhere in this report.&#160; This Annual Report on Form 10-K contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.&#160; See "
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_FORWARDLOOKINGSTATEMENTS">
	Forward-Looking Statements
</A>
	" and Part I, Item 1A. "
</FONT>
<A HREF="#FORM10K_HTM_ITEM1A">
	Risk Factors
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #0000FF">
<U>
	.
</U>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	"
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Hibbett Sports, Inc. is an athletic specialty retailer operating in small to mid-sized markets, predominantly in the South, Southwest, Mid-Atlantic and Midwest regions of the United States.&#160; Hibbett Sports stores provide an extensive selection of premium brand footwear, apparel and team sports equipment, emphasizing convenient locations and a high level of customer service.&#160; As of January 30, 2016, we operated a total of 1,044 stores in 33 states composed of 1,024 Hibbett Sports stores and 20 Sports Additions athletic shoe stores.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Hibbett Sports store is our primary retail format and growth vehicle and is an approximately 5,000 square foot store located primarily in strip centers which are frequently influenced by a Wal-Mart store.&#160; Our Hibbett Sports store base consisted of 821 stores located in strip centers, 23 free-standing stores and 200 enclosed mall locations.&#160; We expect to continue to grow our store base in strip centers versus enclosed malls.&#160; We do not expect that the average size of our stores opening in Fiscal 2017 will vary significantly from the average size of stores opened in Fiscal 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Hibbett operates on a 52- or 53-week fiscal year ending on the Saturday nearest to January 31 of each year.&#160; The consolidated statements of operations for Fiscal 2016, Fiscal 2015 and Fiscal 2014 included 52 weeks of operations.&#160; Fiscal 2017 will include 52 weeks of operations.&#160; We became a public company in October 1996.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fiscal 2016 experienced a total company-wide square footage increase of 5.7%.&#160; Our plan for Fiscal 2017 is to increase total company-wide square footage by 5% to 6%.&#160; To supplement new store openings, we continue to expand high performing stores, increasing the square footage in 16 existing stores in Fiscal 2016 for an average increase in square footage of 37%.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In Fiscal 2016, comparable store sales were approximately flat, although footwear experienced a mid-single digit comparable store gain.&#160; For Fiscal 2017, comparable store sales are expected to increase in the low-single digit range.&#160; We expect merchandise margin to be approximately flat, and expect overall gross profit rate to decline slightly as we incur logistics expenses related to our omni-channel initiative.&#160; Store occupancy expenses are expected to be relatively flat as a percentage of net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We expect operating, selling and administrative rates to increase as a percentage of net sales in Fiscal 2017, primarily due to expenses associated with our omni-channel initiative, overall improvements in our information technology capability and increased health care costs.&#160; We also expect to continue to generate sufficient cash to enable us to expand and remodel our store base, to enable capital expenditures including technology upgrade projects and to repurchase our common stock under our stock repurchase program.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Comparable store net sales data for the periods presented reflects sales for our traditional format Hibbett Sports and Sports Additions stores open throughout the period and the corresponding period of the prior fiscal year.&#160; If a store remodel,&#160; relocation or expansion results in the store being closed for a significant period of time, its sales are removed from the comparable store base until it has been open a full 12 months.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	25
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During Fiscal 2016, Hibbett opened 71 new stores and closed 15 underperforming stores, bringing the store base to 1,044 in 33 states as of January 30, 2016.&#160; Inventory on a per store basis at January 30, 2016, increased by 11.4% compared to the prior fiscal year.&#160; Hibbett ended Fiscal 2016 with $32.3 million of available cash and cash equivalents on the consolidated balance sheet and full availability under its $80.0 million unsecured credit facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Recent Accounting Pronouncements
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	See Note 2 of Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended January 30, 2016, for information regarding recent accounting pronouncements.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#160;5.0
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 47.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Net income
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 2.21%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">

	7.5%
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 2.44%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	&#160;
</TD>

</DIV>

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Note:&#160; Columns may not sum due to rounding.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	26
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fiscal 2016 Compared to Fiscal 2015
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net sales.&#160;
</FONT>
	Net sales increased $29.6 million, or 3.2%, to $943.1 million for Fiscal 2016 from $913.5 million for Fiscal 2015.&#160; Furthermore:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8249BA5FA57B4B0AB2E82FE73836E9FD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We opened 71 Hibbett Sports stores while closing 15 underperforming Hibbett Sports stores for net stores opened of 56 stores in Fiscal 2016.&#160; Stores not in the comparable store net sales calculation accounted for $33.7 million of the increase in net sales.&#160; We expanded, remodeled or relocated 16 high performing stores.&#160; Store openings and closings are reported net of relocations.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F38D6A531C2A4614A1D59ED8191E5004" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Comparable store net sales for Fiscal 2016 declined 0.4% compared to Fiscal 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During Fiscal 2016, 893 stores were included in the comparable store sales comparison.&#160; Comparable store net sales were driven by gains across footwear, offset by declines in apparel and equipment.&#160; Significant increases were achieved in basketball and lifestyle footwear, while branded apparel, baseball equipment and fitness equipment experienced declines.&#160; Additionally, we eliminated the sale of beverages in our stores, which contributed to the decline in equipment.&#160; We continue to see an increase in sales per transaction, primarily due to the on-going trend towards premium product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gross profit.&#160;
</FONT>
	Cost of goods sold includes the cost of inventory, occupancy costs for stores and occupancy and operating costs for our wholesale and logistics facility.&#160; Gross profit was $332.7 million, or 35.3% of net sales, in Fiscal 2016, compared with $326.8 million, or 35.8% of net sales, in Fiscal 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="4E957631077845F99461CE29554A5D34" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Merchandise gross margin decreased as a percentage of net sales due to increased markdowns to liquidate seasonal and aged inventory.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="789861CB7D274ABDA63D3DC0625FCC2E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Wholesale and logistics expenses remained flat as a percentage of net sales for Fiscal 2016.&#160; Increased labor costs associated with our quick replenishment capability were offset by a decrease in occupancy costs due to the lease expiration of our old facility.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="8A517ACDC2254EEF96B7ACCF2ACA5140" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Store occupancy expense increased 26 basis points as a percentage of net sales mainly due to lower comparable sales.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Store operating, selling and administrative expenses.&#160;
</FONT>
	Store operating, selling and administrative expenses were $203.7 million, or 21.6% of net sales, for Fiscal 2016, compared with $192.6 million, or 21.1% of net sales, for Fiscal 2015.&#160; Expense trends we experienced included:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="CC9C72CA51B64E579C9D68A13934195A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Total salary and benefit costs increased by 53 basis points as a percentage of net sales due to lower comparable store sales and higher health care costs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="EAC039409D0D4B15894BE9F3D7A9BA92" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Data processing costs increased 9 basis points as a percentage of net sales due to the implementation of new systems and upgrade of existing systems, as well as significant improvements in our infrastructure and disaster recovery capabilities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="C35D34D7D585450EA7DB0EADD06743CB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Advertising expense increased 6 basis points as a percentage of net sales due to increased costs related to mobile marketing initiatives and communicating to our growing base of loyalty members.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="6EF3B6183B314C27B9944C9B2DA2DD93" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We expect overall store operating, selling and administrative expenses as a percentage of net sales to increase in Fiscal 2017 due to expenses related to our omni-channel initiative, and anticipated increases in health care and information technology costs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Depreciation and amortization.&#160;
</FONT>
	Depreciation and amortization as a percentage of net sales was 1.8% in Fiscal 2016 and in Fiscal 2015.&#160; In Fiscal 2016, depreciation expense increased due to the full year effect of our new wholesale and logistics facility placed in service in April 2014, the addition of new stores and the capitalization of IT investments.&#160; We expect depreciation expense to increase at a higher rate in Fiscal 2017 as we capitalize initial phases of our omni-channel initiative.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Provision for income taxes.&#160;
</FONT>
	The combined federal, state and local effective income tax rate as a percentage of pre-tax income was 36.9% for Fiscal 2016 and 37.6% for Fiscal 2015.&#160; The decrease in rate resulted primarily from additional utilization of state tax credits associated with our wholesale and logistics facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	27
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Fiscal 2015 Compared to Fiscal 2014
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net sales.&#160;
</FONT>
	Net sales increased $61.5 million, or 7.2%, to $913.5 million for Fiscal 2015 from $852.0 million for Fiscal 2014.&#160; Furthermore:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="C122EC49A2F24D9EBF03AA1339927C42" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We opened 80 Hibbett Sports stores while closing 19 underperforming Hibbett Sports stores for net stores opened of 61 stores in Fiscal 2015.&#160; Stores not in the comparable store net sales calculation accounted for $38.3 million of the increase in net sales.&#160; We expanded, remodeled or relocated 10 high performing stores.&#160; Store openings and closings are reported net of relocations.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F3547A757059400E9851975C6DE8B21A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We achieved a 2.9% increase in comparable store net sales for Fiscal 2015 compared to Fiscal 2014.&#160; Comparable store net sales contributed $23.2 million to the increase in net sales.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During Fiscal 2015, 836 stores were included in the comparable store sales comparison.&#160; The increase in comparable store net sales was broad-based with gains across footwear, activewear and cleats.&#160; Significant increases were achieved in basketball and lifestyle footwear, branded apparel, and wrestling, volleyball and soccer cleats.&#160; The majority of our comparable store sales increase was from increased sales per transaction primarily due to a continued trend towards premium product.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gross profit.&#160;
</FONT>
	Cost of goods sold includes the cost of inventory, occupancy costs for stores and occupancy and operating costs for our wholesale and logistics facility.&#160; Gross profit was $326.8 million, or 35.8% of net sales, in Fiscal 2015, compared with $309.3 million, or 36.3% of net sales, in Fiscal 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="3BA67D743FE5497887F65FEFB0CCD27F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Gross profit rate decreased as a percentage of net sales due to increased markdowns to liquidate aged inventory.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F8A0A8BF4E9C43CE9D34C44BDB4CDEF8" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Wholesale and logistics expenses as a percentage of net sales remained relatively flat, decreasing 1 basis point.&#160; Decreased labor costs as a percentage of net sales due to improvements in labor efficiency as well as a decrease in occupancy costs offset other volume-related cost increases.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="96607139F14940BFB7780E80FDDE914E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Store occupancy expense as a percentage of net sales increased 12 basis points due to increases in rent, utility and real estate taxes.&#160; However, as comparable sales improved in the fourth quarter, these expenses decreased 4 basis points as a percentage of net sales.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Store operating, selling and administrative expenses.&#160;
</FONT>
	Store operating, selling and administrative expenses were $192.6 million, or 21.1% of net sales, for Fiscal 2015, compared with $181.5 million, or 21.3% of net sales, for Fiscal 2014.&#160; Expense trends we experienced included:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="6A45E7E50BF84477A93DE682DE178698" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Total salary and benefit costs increased in dollars, but decreased as a percentage of net sales by 16 basis points due to higher comparable store sales and lower health care costs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="F4681A0791BE4C8C942747A28018E318" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Stock-based compensation decreased by 19 basis points as a percentage of net sales due to a larger number of equity award forfeitures in the current year compared to the previous year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="255067297DCA4CF3A4CC15C84C73B05B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Expenses associated with costs of our old distribution center not included in cost of goods sold increased 5 basis points as a percentage of net sales.&#160; The lease on our old center expired in December 2014.&#160; A complete year of expense related to our new corporate headquarters added 5 basis points as a percentage of net sales.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TABLE ID="1E1E7D27D806498EA039C9ED8E382E71" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Professional fees increased 7 basis points as a percentage of net sales due to an increase in consulting fees for the planning of our omni-channel initiative and other elements of our strategic plan.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Depreciation and amortization.&#160;
</FONT>
	Depreciation and amortization as a percentage of net sales was 1.8% in Fiscal 2015 and 1.6% in Fiscal 2014.&#160; In Fiscal 2015, the addition of our new wholesale and logistics facility placed in service in April 2014, the addition of new stores and the capitalization of IT investments, resulted in an elevated depreciation expense in both dollars and in percentage of net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Provision for income taxes.&#160;
</FONT>
	The combined federal, state and local effective income tax rate as a percentage of pre-tax income was 37.6% for Fiscal 2015 and 37.7% for Fiscal 2014.&#160; The decrease in rate resulted primarily from a settlement with a state taxing authority during Fiscal 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	28
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
